oai_dc:dc.dc:title: 1966-issue Republic of Vietnam 500-Dong note

Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees that may be necessary for the intended use.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The front depicts Trang Hung Dao, and the reverse possibly depicts the Battle of Bach Dang River.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Money
Vietnam War, 1961-1975; Paper money
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Trang Hung Dao (1228-1300) was the Supreme Commander of Dai Viet ("Great Viet") during the Tran Dynasty. He successfully repelled two major Mongol invasions by Kublai Khan. The Battle of Bach Dang River in 1288 ended the Third Mongol Invasion of Dai Viet.
